conversations.content: You are an assistant
Provide a breakfast recipe for someone with Type 1 diabetes and fasting glucose of 120 mg/dL. My fasting blood sugar is stable at 120 mg/dL. I need a filling breakfast recipe to start the day.

{
  "title": "Poached Egg and Avocado Toast with Warm Cherry Tomatoes and Sea Salt",
  "ingredients": [
    "4 slices good-quality whole wheat, barley, or oat bread",
    "4 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil",
    "2 ripe avocados, halved and pitted",
    "4 eggs",
    "1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved",
    "1/8 teaspoon unrefined sea salt, plus extra for water"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Toast the bread in a toaster or under the broiler to desired doneness.",
    "Drizzle 1/2 teaspoon olive oil over each piece of toast.",
    "Scoop avocado onto toast, spreading evenly.",
    "Bring a pot of salted water to a gentle boil and stir to create a vortex.",
    "Add eggs one at a time to the swirling water and poach for 2.5–3 minutes.",
    "Remove poached eggs with a slotted spoon and place on toast.",
    "Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, add tomatoes, and cook for 2–3 minutes until softened.",
    "Scatter cooked tomatoes over toast, sprinkle with sea salt, and serve."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 315,
    "fat": "21g",
    "carbohydrates": "24g",
    "fiber": "7g",
    "protein": "11g"
  },
  "meal_time": "breakfast",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "5 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "12 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}
You are an assistant

Provide a breakfast recipe for someone with Type 2 diabetes who wants a fiber-rich and low glycemic index option.

I want a quick and healthy snack that is high in fiber and has a low glycemic index.

{
  "title": "Blueberry-Almond Yogurt Bowls with Honey, Cinnamon, and Chia Seeds",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 cup organic blueberries",
    "1/2 cup plain, unsalted, whole almonds",
    "1 cup plain (unsweetened) Greek yogurt",
    "2 tablespoons chia seeds",
    "2 teaspoons raw honey",
    "1 teaspoon ground pure cinnamon (Ceylon)"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Divide the blueberries and almonds evenly between two bowls.",
    "Pour 1/2 cup of yogurt over the top of each bowl.",
    "Scatter 1 tablespoon chia seeds and 1 teaspoon honey over the yogurt in each bowl.",
    "Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon over the top of each bowl and serve."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 412,
    "fat": "24g",
    "saturated_fat": "3g",
    "cholesterol": "13mg",
    "sodium": "38mg",
    "carbohydrates": "33g",
    "fiber": "11g",
    "protein": "21g"
  },
  "meal_time": "breakfast",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "5 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "0 Minutes",
  "Yield": "2 Servings"
}
You are an assistant

Provide a fiber-rich breakfast recipe for someone managing Type 2 diabetes with a fasting glucose level of 130 mg/dL.

I need a healthy breakfast that is high in fiber and uses natural sweetness, as my fasting glucose is 130 mg/dL.

{
  "title": "Fresh Fruit Salad with Homemade Vanilla and Flaxseed Granola",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 cup cantaloupe, cubed",
    "1/2 cup blueberries",
    "1/2 cup sliced kiwi",
    "1 cup whole rolled oats",
    "1/4 cup chopped almonds",
    "2 teaspoons flaxseeds",
    "1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract",
    "1/4 cup creamy almond butter"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "In a large bowl, combine the cantaloupe, blueberries, and kiwi.",
    "Preheat the oven to 300°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.",
    "In a medium bowl, combine the oats, almonds, flaxseeds, vanilla, and almond butter. Stir until evenly mixed.",
    "Stir until combined. Scoop the granola onto the baking sheet and press the mixture into a 1-inch-thick oval. This will encourage clumping.",
    "Bake for 8 minutes. Use a fork or spatula to gently break the granola apart and turn it.",
    "Bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the granola is golden brown.",
    "Use the parchment paper to lift the granola out of the pan and transfer it to a cooling rack. Allow it to cool completely (about 15 minutes).",
    "Divide the fruit mixture into individual bowls and top with equal portions of the granola."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 261,
    "fat": "15g",
    "saturated_fat": "1g",
    "cholesterol": "0mg",
    "sodium": "80mg",
    "carbohydrates": "28g",
    "fiber": "5g",
    "protein": "7g"
  },
  "meal_time": "breakfast",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "5 Minutes plus 5 hours to over night for marinating",
  "cook_time": "0 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}
You are an assistant

Provide a warm breakfast recipe for someone with Type 2 diabetes looking for a high-protein and low glycemic index option.

Iâd like a warm and nutritious breakfast that includes a complete protein and helps manage my blood sugar levels.

{
  "title": "Warm Raspberry and Cocoa Quinoa with Almond Milk and Sesame Seeds",
  "ingredients": [
    "1/2 cup dry quinoa, rinsed",
    "2 teaspoons plain, unsweetened cocoa powder",
    "1 teaspoon pure vanilla",
    "1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk",
    "2 teaspoons pure raw honey (optional)",
    "1 cup fresh raspberries or blueberries",
    "2 tablespoons raw sesame seeds"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Bring 1 cup of water to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat.",
    "Add the quinoa, cocoa powder, and vanilla to the boiling water. Stir, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10–15 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed.",
    "Remove from heat and allow the quinoa to cool slightly.",
    "Stir in the almond milk and, if desired, add honey for sweetness.",
    "Divide the quinoa into two bowls and top with fresh raspberries or blueberries.",
    "Sprinkle sesame seeds on top and serve warm."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 262,
    "fat": "8g",
    "saturated_fat": "1g",
    "cholesterol": "0mg",
    "sodium": "4mg",
    "carbohydrates": "42g",
    "fiber": "7g",
    "protein": "9g"
  },
  "meal_time": "breakfast",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "5 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "0 Minutes",
  "Yield": "2 Servings"
}
You are an assistant

Provide a quick and balanced breakfast recipe for someone with Type 2 diabetes, focusing on low carbohydrates and healthy fats.

I need a diabetes-friendly breakfast that is quick to prepare, low in carbs, and includes healthy fats.

{
  "title": "Middle Eastern–Style Breakfast Platter",
  "ingredients": [
    "2 Persian cucumbers or 1 English cucumber, sliced",
    "2 Roma tomatoes, sliced",
    "1 handful fresh mint or parsley (or a combination), cleaned",
    "1/2 cup labneh cheese or Greek yogurt",
    "2 hardboiled eggs",
    "2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil",
    "2 teaspoons Za’atar spice mix or unrefined sea salt"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "On two separate plates or a large platter, arrange cucumber slices and tomatoes decoratively on half of the plate.",
    "Add fresh mint and/or parsley to the center of the plate.",
    "Dollop the labneh or Greek yogurt onto one quadrant of the plate.",
    "Slice the hardboiled eggs into quarters and place next to the labneh.",
    "Drizzle the eggs and labneh with olive oil and sprinkle with Za’atar spice mix or sea salt.",
    "Serve immediately."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 277,
    "fat": "20g",
    "saturated_fat": "4g",
    "cholesterol": "218mg",
    "sodium": "287mg",
    "carbohydrates": "10g",
    "fiber": "3g",
    "protein": "14g"
  },
  "meal_time": "breakfast",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "5 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "0 Minutes",
  "Yield": "2 Servings"
}
You are an assistant

Provide a traditional and quick meal recipe suitable for someone managing Type 2 diabetes, emphasizing protein and fiber.

I need a diabetes-friendly, high-protein, and fiber-rich meal that is quick to prepare and rooted in Middle Eastern flavors.

{
  "title": "Egyptian Fuul Medammes with Extra-Virgin Olive Oil, Tomato, and Eggs",
  "ingredients": [
    "5 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil",
    "1 (15-ounce) can cooked fava beans with juice",
    "1/2 teaspoon cumin",
    "1/2 teaspoon dried ground coriander",
    "1/8 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste",
    "4 hardboiled eggs, quartered",
    "4 Roma tomatoes, diced",
    "4 pieces whole wheat pita bread (optional)"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "In a medium frying pan, heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil over medium-low heat.",
    "Add the fava beans along with their juice, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper. Stir well to combine.",
    "Cook for about 5 minutes, or until most of the liquid is absorbed.",
    "Reduce the heat to low and lightly mash the beans with a fork or potato masher until they reach a texture slightly looser than refried beans.",
    "Divide the bean mixture evenly onto four plates.",
    "Arrange the quartered hardboiled eggs around the edges of each plate.",
    "Make a small well in the center of each serving and drizzle 1 teaspoon of olive oil into it.",
    "Top with diced tomatoes and serve with whole wheat pita bread if desired."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 213,
    "fat": "11g",
    "saturated_fat": "2g",
    "cholesterol": "211mg",
    "sodium": "682mg",
    "carbohydrates": "16g",
    "fiber": "5g",
    "protein": "13g"
  },
  "meal_time": "breakfast, lunch, or dinner",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "2 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "5 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}
You are an assistant

Provide a quick and healthy smoothie recipe for someone with Type 2 diabetes looking for a low-calorie, nutrient-dense option.

I need a smoothie recipe that supports glucose metabolism and is refreshing, nutrient-rich, and low in calories.

{
  "title": "Cardamom-Scented Kefir, Pineapple, and Kiwi Smoothie",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 cup kefir",
    "1 teaspoon ground cardamom",
    "1/2 cup fresh pineapple chunks",
    "2 kiwis, peeled",
    "1 cup ice"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Place all ingredients into a blender.",
    "Blend on high power until the mixture is smooth and creamy.",
    "Pour the smoothie into two glasses and serve cold."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 116,
    "fat": "2g",
    "saturated_fat": "1g",
    "cholesterol": "5mg",
    "sodium": "131mg",
    "carbohydrates": "22g",
    "fiber": "3g",
    "protein": "5g"
  },
  "meal_time": "snack or breakfast",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "5 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "0 Minutes",
  "Yield": "2 Servings"
}

Provide a high-fiber, diabetes-friendly lunch recipe with healthy fats and fresh vegetables.

I need a lunch idea that incorporates hummus, whole wheat pita, and fresh vegetables.

{
  "title": "Homemade Hummus and Whole Wheat Pita with Fresh Vegetables",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 cup cooked or no salt added canned chickpeas",
    "1 garlic clove, minced",
    "1/3 cup tahini sauce",
    "3 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil",
    "1/2 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "2 ice cubes",
    "Dash of paprika, for garnish",
    "2 cups broccoli flowerets",
    "2 cups cauliflower flowerets",
    "1 English cucumber, sliced",
    "1 cup cherry tomatoes",
    "4 pieces whole wheat pita bread, cut into triangles"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Peel chickpeas and place them in a food processor.",
    "Add garlic, tahini, 2 tablespoons olive oil, and salt. Puree until smooth.",
    "Add ice cubes and puree again. Adjust consistency with water if needed.",
    "Spoon hummus into a serving dish and garnish with remaining olive oil and paprika.",
    "Serve with broccoli, cauliflower, cucumbers, tomatoes, and pita bread."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 329,
    "fat": "15g",
    "saturated_fat": "2g",
    "cholesterol": "0mg",
    "sodium": "426mg",
    "carbohydrates": "0g",
    "fiber": "9g",
    "protein": "13g"
  },
  "meal_time": "lunch",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "10 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "0 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}

Provide a warming, protein-rich soup recipe suitable for diabetes management.

I need a hearty soup recipe with lamb, lentils, and vegetables for lunch.

{
  "title": "Moroccan Rice, Lamb, Vegetable, and Lentil Soup",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 medium yellow onion, diced",
    "1 pound lamb leg meat, cut into 1/2-inch pieces",
    "1/2 cup brown lentils",
    "1/2 cup tomato puree",
    "4 cups vegetable or chicken stock",
    "1 teaspoon ground coriander",
    "1/2 teaspoon ground cumin",
    "1/2 teaspoon ground ginger",
    "1/2 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper",
    "1/4 cup medium grain rice",
    "4 stalks celery, finely chopped",
    "4 carrots, peeled and diced",
    "1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped",
    "1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "In a large pot, combine onion, lamb, lentils, tomato puree, stock, coriander, cumin, ginger, salt, and pepper.",
    "Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes.",
    "Add rice, celery, carrots, cilantro, and parsley. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.",
    "Serve hot."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 419,
    "fat": "10g",
    "saturated_fat": "3g",
    "cholesterol": "67mg",
    "sodium": "825mg",
    "carbohydrates": "49g",
    "fiber": "11g",
    "protein": "33g"
  },
  "meal_time": "lunch",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "15 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "50 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}

Provide a high-protein, diabetes-friendly salad bowl recipe with quinoa and avocado.

I need a nutritious lunch recipe with sweet potato, quinoa, and greens.

{
  "title": "Roasted Sweet Potato, Avocado, and Quinoa Bowls with Honey-Lime Dressing",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 sweet potato",
    "1/2 cup quinoa",
    "1 pound fresh baby spinach",
    "1 avocado, sliced",
    "1/4 cup unsalted cashews",
    "4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil",
    "Juice and zest of 2 limes",
    "1 teaspoon raw honey",
    "1/8 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Cook the sweet potato by roasting or microwaving until tender.",
    "Boil quinoa in 1 cup of water until tender, then drain and cool.",
    "Layer spinach, sweet potato chunks, quinoa, avocado, and cashews in two bowls.",
    "Whisk together olive oil, lime juice, honey, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.",
    "Drizzle dressing over the salad and garnish with lime zest."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 727,
    "fat": "48g",

}

Provide a light and diabetes-friendly salad recipe with chicken and Middle Eastern flavors.

I need a Mediterranean-inspired salad recipe for lunch with chicken and fresh vegetables.

{
  "title": "Lebanese Fattoush Salad with Citrus-Infused Chicken",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 pound boneless chicken breast, sliced",
    "4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil",
    "2 tablespoons pomegranate molasses",
    "Juice of 2 lemons",
    "2 teaspoons white wine vinegar",
    "1 teaspoon dried mint",
    "1 cucumber, diced",
    "4 Roma tomatoes, chopped",
    "1 medium red onion, sliced",
    "1 green pepper, diced",
    "2 teaspoons sumac",
    "1 piece whole wheat pita bread, cut into pieces"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Mix olive oil, pomegranate molasses, lemon juice, vinegar, and mint to make a dressing.",
    "Toss chicken with half the dressing and roast at 425°F for 15 minutes.",
    "Combine cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and green pepper in a large bowl.",
    "Toast pita pieces with sumac until golden.",
    "Add chicken, vegetables, and pita to the bowl and toss with the remaining dressing."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 245,
    "fat": "15g",
    "saturated_fat": "2g",
    "cholesterol": "11mg",
    "sodium": "232mg",

    "fiber": "3g",

  },
  "meal_time": "lunch",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "10 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "15 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}

Provide a diabetes-friendly noodle salad recipe with plenty of vegetables and a tangy dressing.

I need a filling, colorful noodle salad with a sweet and tangy dressing for lunch.

{
  "title": "Asian Noodle and Seven-Vegetable Salad with Sweet and Tangy Ginger Sauce",
  "ingredients": [
    "8 ounces brown rice dry noodles",
    "4 cups mix of red cabbage, carrots, and radish, shredded",
    "1 red bell pepper, sliced",
    "2 cups broccoli and cauliflower flowerets",
    "1 cup frozen edamame, thawed",
    "1/2 bunch cilantro, chopped",
    "1/4 inch fresh ginger root or 1/2 teaspoon dried ground ginger",
    "2 cloves garlic",
    "1/4 cup almond butter",
    "1/4 cup fresh orange juice",
    "1/4 cup fresh lime juice",
    "1 tablespoon low-sodium tamari sauce",
    "2 tablespoons raw honey or agave",
    "2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil",
    "1 teaspoon chili paste (optional)",
    "1/4–1/2 cup roasted, crushed peanuts (garnish)"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Prepare rice noodles according to package directions, then drain and rinse.",
    "Combine shredded cabbage, carrots, radish, bell pepper, broccoli, cauliflower, edamame, and cilantro in a large bowl.",
    "Toss noodles into the vegetable mix.",
    "Blend ginger, garlic, almond butter, orange juice, lime juice, tamari, honey, sesame oil, and chili paste to make the dressing.",
    "Pour dressing over the noodles and vegetables, tossing to coat evenly.",
    "Serve garnished with crushed peanuts."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 553,
    "fat": "23g",
    "saturated_fat": "3g",
    "cholesterol": "0mg",
    "sodium": "406mg",
    "carbohydrates": "79g",
    "fiber": "8g",
    "protein": "14g"
  },
  "meal_time": "lunch",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "20 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "10 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}

Provide a comforting and diabetes-friendly lunch recipe featuring a creamy broccoli soup and stuffed mushrooms.

Iâm looking for a lunch idea that includes a warm soup and a side of stuffed mushrooms.

{
  "title": "Broccoli and Pecorino Cheese Soup with Stuffed Baby Portobello Mushrooms",
  "ingredients": [
    "1 1/2 pounds fresh broccoli, cut into flowerets",
    "1 large onion, chopped",
    "1 carrot, peeled and chopped",
    "1/2 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper",
    "3 tablespoons all-purpose flour",
    "4 cups vegetable or chicken stock",
    "1/4 cup plain Greek-style yogurt",
    "4 Portobello mushrooms, rinsed and dried",
    "4 tablespoons olive oil",
    "1/2 cup fresh bread crumbs",
    "1/4 cup Pecorino or Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, grated",
    "1/4 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded",
    "1 tablespoon fresh basil, chopped",
    "2 cups baby arugula",
    "1 lemon, juiced and zested",
    "1/4 cup parsley, chopped"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Heat olive oil in a large pot, sauté broccoli, onion, carrot, salt, and pepper until soft.",
    "Add flour, stir, and cook for 1 minute. Add stock, bring to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes.",
    "Puree soup, return to pot, and stir in yogurt.",
    "For mushrooms, mix chopped stems, bread crumbs, cheeses, and basil.",
    "Stuff mushroom caps, broil at 500°F until golden, about 3–5 minutes.",
    "Serve soup with mushrooms on a bed of arugula garnished with lemon juice and parsley."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 534,
    "fat": "32g",
    "saturated_fat": "6g",
    "cholesterol": "18mg",
    "sodium": "548mg",
    "carbohydrates": "45g",
    "fiber": "8g",
    "protein": "21g"
  },
  "meal_time": "lunch",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",

  "cook_time": "20 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}

Provide a hearty, diabetes-friendly vegetable and farro soup recipe for lunch.

I want a filling and nutritious vegetable soup thatâs diabetes-friendly and includes farro or similar grains.

{
  "title": "Hearty Farro and Five-Vegetable Minestrone",
  "ingredients": [
    "2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil",
    "1 stalk celery, diced",
    "1 carrot, diced",
    "1 large yellow onion, diced",
    "2 cloves garlic, minced",
    "1/4 cup dried porcini mushrooms, soaked and rinsed",
    "2 cups tomato sauce or diced tomatoes",
    "2 cups chopped savoy cabbage",
    "1/4 cup brown lentils, rinsed",
    "1/2 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper",
    "4 cups vegetable or chicken stock",
    "1 cup farro, barley, or whole wheat pasta"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Sauté celery, carrot, onion, and garlic in olive oil until golden.",
    "Add mushrooms, tomatoes, cabbage, lentils, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes.",
    "Add stock, bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 40 minutes.",
    "Add farro and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Serve hot."
  ],

Provide a diabetes-friendly lunch recipe featuring baba ghanouj and roasted chickpeas.

I need a lunch recipe with eggplant dip and roasted chickpeas, served with fresh vegetables.

{
  "title": "Baba Ghanouj with Crudités and Roasted Chickpeas",
  "ingredients": [
    "2 medium eggplants",
    "2 tablespoons tahini sauce",
    "4 tablespoons olive oil",
    "Juice of 1 lemon",
    "1 garlic clove, minced",
    "Unrefined sea salt, to taste",
    "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste",
    "1 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas",
    "1/2 teaspoon unrefined sea salt",
    "1 teaspoon paprika",
    "2 cups broccoli florets",
    "2 cups carrot sticks",
    "1 English cucumber, sliced"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Broil eggplants until charred and soft. Peel and mash pulp.",
    "Mix mashed eggplant with tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.",
    "Toss chickpeas with olive oil, salt, and paprika, then roast at 425°F until crisp.",
    "Serve baba ghanouj with roasted chickpeas, broccoli, carrots, and cucumber."
  ],
  "nutritional_info": {
    "calories": 275,
    "fat": "9g",
    "saturated_fat": "1g",
    "cholesterol": "0mg",
    "sodium": "441mg",
    "carbohydrates": "43g",
    "fiber": "15g",
    "protein": "10g"
  },
  "meal_time": "lunch",
  "diabetes_type": "Type 1 and Type 2",
  "prep_time": "15 Minutes",
  "cook_time": "20 Minutes",
  "Yield": "4 Servings"
}

Provide a diabetes-friendly recipe for citrus-marinated salmon with roasted potatoes and kale.

I need a healthy recipe featuring salmon, kale, and potatoes, suitable for dinner.

{
  "title": "Citrus-Marinated Salmon with Fiery Potatoes and Kale",
  "ingredients": [
    "6 tablespoons olive oil",
    "1/4 cup orange juice",
    "1/2 teaspoon sea salt",
    "Black pepper to taste",
    "4 (4-ounce) salmon fillets",
    "4 medium Yukon gold potatoes, chopped",
    "4 garlic cloves, finely chopped",
    "Crushed red chili pepper to taste",
    "1/2 pound fresh kale, chopped",
    "1 sweet onion, thinly sliced",
    "1 cup plain Greek yogurt",
    "2 oranges (1 zested, 1 sliced)"
  ],
  "instructions": [
    "Whisk 2 tablespoons of olive oil, orange juice, salt, and pepper.",
    "Marinate salmon in a baking dish for 1 hour.",
